channel.title: [718/742] Randomly Stopped Working?
channel.description: So I was hosting my RSPS a few nights ago, randomly in the night I got a message on skype "Your server isn't working???" I then tried re-running/compiling, nothing. I'm portfowarded (Via Router Control Panel & µtorrent, canyouseeme.org says 43594 is open) Nobody can connect, 5 or so people were on but now nobody can connect, not even me on 127.0.0.1? [code]Error_js5connect[/code]

item.title: [718/742] Randomly Stopped Working?
item.dc:creator: @NexRSPS NexRSPS
item.description:
@NexRSPS wrote:

Thanks for the tips, both sub-revisions ARE “3”. Haydnz helped me with that as it was my first problem, which then fixed the server BEFORE this happened.
Any other ideas? Doing the re-portforward ATM.

///bump

Read full topic

item.title: [718/742] Randomly Stopped Working?
item.dc:creator: @B0SS B0SS
item.description:
@B0SS wrote:

Here you go this is how you fix the error_j5connect problem
go in your cleint folders>open loader.java> and make sure you public static int SUB_REVISION is this----- > public static int SUB_REVISION = 1;

Read full topic

item.title: [718/742] Randomly Stopped Working?
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

my friend… 1 tip only portforward from ur router settings never ever portforward using (utorrent) it messes with your connection man, delete or fully exit utorrent from task manager, and re-try running it , it will work if not pm me ill get it working in a jeffy…

Read full topic

item.title: [718/742] Randomly Stopped Working?
item.dc:creator: @Ashi Ashi
item.description:
@Ashi wrote:

[quote=“Haydnz1234, post:11, topic:497481”][quote author=Potzon link=topic=615714.msg4243466#msg4243466 date=1361954695]
“Error_js5connect” means that your client can’t connect to the server (I’m sure you know that).
Might not work, but change

to

(Client sided, Loader.java)

Then compile your client, run the server and try to open the client again…
[/quote]

It’s not this, he said that 5 players were on at the time, so it’s clearly working… I even made sure of that. They are both sub_revision 3 though so I’ll recommend that to him… He’ll probably reply if its working or not.

5 or so people were on but now nobody can connect, not even me on 127.0.0.1?[/quote]

It’s most likely a server error, did you mess around with networking/login or anything related?

Read full topic

item.title: [718/742] Randomly Stopped Working?
item.dc:creator: @NexRSPS NexRSPS
item.description:
@NexRSPS wrote:

[quote=“noah1gamble, post:5, topic:497481”][quote author=Haydnz1234 link=topic=615714.msg4242442#msg4242442 date=1361900658]

What EXACTLY where you doing when the server crashed? Also what Base/Client?

I’m on his teamviewer trying to sort it, he said he was sleeping and it’s reduction, I’ve told him to replace with original server, we’ve done. 43594 open, he can’t even get on with localhost…
[/quote]That is the wierdest thing ever! Is there any kind of error or indication of whats wrong.[/quote]
nope server inits fine
Only js5connect on client
